answers.answer: What way the outcome of your pregnancy?  I had my 7.5 week ultrasound today and I have a heart beat with poor fetal poll.  Showing around 6.3 weeks. I am going back in a week to discuss outcome and options.
It's a waiting game unfortunatly, I wish you the best dear, only time will tell, I hope it's just a late bloomer.
I have type 2 diabetes and high blood pressure....my body was 2 months pregnant yet the fetal pole was at 6 wks and 3 days and had no heartbeat. A D & C was done.

question: We did IVF and should be 8 weeks and 2 days pregnant.  First u/s at 7 weeks showed fetal pole development of 6 weeks with no h/b.  Did another u/s week later, fetal pole at 2.5 mm (measuring at 5.5 weeks) with pulsing and slow heart beat. Dr. recommends waiting one more weeks to do another u/s before making any decisions but thinks there's is a strong chance of miscarriage due to the slow development. How accurate is the u/s in measuring the fetal pole...how could it go from 6 weeks to 5.5 weeks (both were done by different techs) I heard that sometimes the embyo may take longer to implant so that the dates could be off by a few days.  Any similar experiences that turned out successfully or does it look like this pregancy is doomed?
title: slow fetal pole growth
